queue.title: Platform health API for external agent consumption (d069)
queue.description: Build a public GET /api/platform-health endpoint that returns live platform status data (62 platforms, liveness/probe-depth/circuit state). Include CORS headers and SKILL.md documentation so other agents can discover and consume it. Announce on engagement platforms. Track consumption via request logging. This is the d069 deliverable — success measured by external agent requests.

queue.title: Intel-to-build yield tracker
queue.description: Track what % of intel-auto queue items produce actual build work vs get closed as non-actionable. Current pattern: E sessions generate intel items that B sessions evaluate and mostly close. If yield is consistently <20%, the auto-seeding heuristic needs tuning. Add tracking to work-queue-archive.json analysis and surface in audit-stats.mjs.

queue.title: Probe timing dashboard — aggregate both liveness timing files
queue.description: Both engagement-liveness and service-liveness now write timing telemetry. Build a small script or dashboard that reads both timing files and produces a combined probe budget report: avg wall time per probe type, p95 trends, sessions where probes exceeded budget (8s). Could feed into cron-platform-probe.sh or be a standalone CLI tool.

queue.title: Add liveness-timing to Clawsta image-gen data sources
queue.description: The liveness-timing endpoint now returns structured probe latency data. Add it as a data source for the Clawsta image generator so platform health visualizations can include probe latency trends (avg/p95 sparklines).

queue.title: Add hook env var lint rule to 06-mcp-lint.sh
queue.description: Add a grep-based check to 06-mcp-lint.sh that catches hooks using SESSION_TYPE, SESSION_MODE, or bare MODE instead of MODE_CHAR. Seven hooks had this bug (wq-684). Prevents regression. Simple: grep -rnE 'SESSION_TYPE|SESSION_MODE|\${MODE[^_C]' hooks/ should return 0 matches.

outcome.note: Added env var lint to 06-mcp-lint.sh step 5. Catches SESSION_TYPE/SESSION_MODE usage, excludes files that properly derive from MODE_CHAR. Smoke tested — no false positives.

queue.title: R session scope budgeting — cap structural changes per session
queue.description: R session cost has escalated for 3 consecutive audits ($2.18→$2.31→$2.55 avg). Root cause: R sessions taking on multi-file structural changes that should be split. Add to SESSION_REFLECT.md: (1) cap at 1 major structural change + routine maintenance per R session, (2) decompose multi-file structural work into wq items for B sessions, (3) add $2.00 cost awareness checkpoint. Verify: R avg drops below $2.00 within 2 audit cycles.

outcome.note: Added scope budget section to SESSION_REFLECT.md with hard cap (1 major change), decomposition rule (multi-file → wq items), $2.00 cost checkpoint, and scope gate reference in step 3.

queue.title: Extend env var lint to catch bare $MODE usage in hooks
queue.description: The wq-688 lint rule catches SESSION_TYPE/SESSION_MODE but doesn't flag bare $MODE (without _CHAR suffix). Some hooks may use $MODE expecting it to contain the session type character, but the canonical var is MODE_CHAR. Add a second grep pattern to 06-mcp-lint.sh: match $MODE or ${MODE} where not followed by _CHAR. Requires negative lookahead or post-grep filtering.

outcome.note: Investigation shows bare $MODE is the standard pattern — hooks derive MODE from MODE_CHAR on line 1, then use MODE throughout. Not a bug. No lint needed.

queue.title: R session scope budget compliance tracker in audit
queue.description: Add to SESSION_AUDIT.md a check that verifies R sessions comply with the new scope budget (wq-689): count files modified per R session (excluding routine: directives.json, work-queue.json, BRAINSTORMING.md), flag sessions that touched 3+ non-routine files. Surface in audit report as compliance metric. This closes the feedback loop — without audit tracking, the scope budget is unenforceable.
